title: Deliberative Accountability in Parliamentary Committees
itunes:author: Professor Cheryl Schonhardt Bailey, Dr Stephen Holden Bates, Lord Tyrie
description: Contributor(s): Professor Cheryl Schonhardt Bailey, Dr Stephen Holden Bates, Lord Tyrie | In recent decades, we have seen an explosion in expectations for greater accountability of public policymaking. But, as accountability has increased, trust in governments and politicians has fallen. By focusing on the heart of public accountability—the reason-giving by policymakers for their policy decisions (i.e. deliberative accountability)
